text: for over a decade now the AFC East has
held the crown of worst division the NFL
more consistently than any other in the
league in combining all of the records
of teams that aren't the Pats since the
2002 realignment you get a grand total
of 387 wins - 456 losses which isn't the
worst mark in the NFL considering
there's been a lot of mediocrity in
there but it certainly looks that way
when you include the fact that the team
not named the New England Patriots has
only won the division once in the last
16 years so even if the AFC East hasn't
been the worst division in football it's
certainly been the least competitive and
based on the general consensus that
doesn't seem to be changing anytime soon
the Patriots are still here as they
painfully reminded us and their defense
and offensive line remain as strong as

trying to put the pieces together and
